forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 53. West southwest wind 7 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight approaches in Downtown San Francisco, the remnants of the day linger gently in the air, settling into a cool evening. The sky is partly cloudy, draping a delicate veil that hints at the crispness of the night to come. With temperatures likely dipping towards the low fifties, a brisk west-southwest wind dances through the streets, reminding you of the ocean’s presence just beyond the city limits. 

Tomorrow promises a brighter perspective, as mostly sunny skies unfurl with a high near sixty-six, gradually softening to a mid-afternoon lull at sixty-four. While the gusts may taper, the presence of that subtle marine layer accentuates the day’s character, adding a touch of serenity that one can grasp. The clarity looks inviting, urging residents to step out and savor the unfolding possibilities. Casual layers—perhaps a light jacket or scarf—will allow one to embrace the coastal chill without a hint of discomfort. As the sun sinks lower, it’s an opportune time for a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero, where the bustling energy of the city fades into a tranquil hum as it wraps itself in the cloak of night.
